lead_paragraph: The storms that swept West Virginia last Thursday created historic flooding and in the aftermath left hundreds of homes, buildings, bridges, roads and vehicles destroyed.

byline.contributor: Mike McPhate contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: Battered by Storms Linked to 24 Deaths, West Virginia Struggles to Recover
headline.main: Battered by Storms, West Virginia Struggles to Recover

snippet: The storms that swept West Virginia last Thursday created historic flooding and in the aftermath left hundreds of homes, buildings, bridges, roads and vehicles destroyed.
abstract: Heavier-than-expected storms rip through West Virginia, devastating property and leading to 24 fatalities; majority of deaths are in Greenbrier County, which has been forced to cancel upcoming PGA tournament, dealing huge economic blow to local business.
